<a target="_blank" href="https://www.peoplescollection.wales/itesm/19086">Transcription for 19086</a>

Mildoranda was a hotbed of singing, you know, really good class singers
come from this locality and choirs because the old Mildoranda choir was about 250 strong.
Now they can't keep a choir going, a mixed choir. The only choirs that are in the valley now
really are the male voice choirs. There used to be a very very good ladies choir here,
the Mildoranda ladies choir, the wife was in that, and the mixed choir which we were both in.
But anyhow, no, it changed that way a lot, you know, social life that way. I think people are
more inclined now if they want to hear some singing, they go down to the nearest hall,
like see, and pay five or six quid for it. But, oh, there you are, that's modern times, isn't it?
